trial_identification.studytitle: How androgens exert their anabolic effects. Interaction of testosterone and growth hormone at the hepatic level.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: How androgens exert their anabolic effects: Interaction of testosterone and growth hormone at the hepatic level in men with hypogonadism or hypopituitarism.

interventions.interventions: oral micronised testosterone 5 - 40 mg daily for 2 - 5 periods of 14 days. transdermal testosterone (Androderm) 5mg daily for 1 -3 periods of 14 days. recominant human growth hormone (GH)(Humatrope) 0.5 mg daily for 18 weeks (GH deficient subjects only!)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Biochemical markers of GH-IGF-axis and bone turnover
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after each 14 day treatment period

primaryOutcome.outcome: Measurements of substrate metabolism and protein turnover
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after each 14 day treatment period

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Department of Endocrinology, St Vincents Hospital Sydney

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Observations from previous studies suggest that the full action of GH requires the presence of male hormones like Testosterone (T). We will test the hypothesis that T enhances GH effect acting on the liver. We will compare the body protein production after delivering T exclusively to the liver (capsules) and to peripheral tissues (patch). The first phase (11 weeks, 6 visits) aims to find the T dose which exposes the liver to normal/physiological T levels. The second phase (16 weeks, 5 visits) will compare the effect of delivering T to the liver and to peripheral tissues.
